posts.summary: Meta is reportedly negotiating a groundbreaking investment—potentially exceeding $10 billion—in Los Angeles–based Scale AI, a leading data‑labeling firm. Scale AI, already valued at $13.8 billion after its 2024 $1 billion round, provides clean datasets critical for training large‑language models. A deal of this scale could mark Meta’s largest external AI investment and shift its strategy toward acquiring next‑generation data infrastructure.
posts.content:
Meta’s Ambitious Bet on Scale AI: Transforming Data Pipelines

Meta Platforms Inc. is reportedly in advanced talks for an investment exceeding $10 billion into Scale AI—an industry‑leading data‑labeling startup that plays a pivotal role in training large‑scale AI models.


Scale AI currently supports tech giants like Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI by providing precise, curated datasets essential for LLM development. Its May 2024 funding round valued the company at $13.8 billion, and subsequent discussions aim to elevate that valuation to around $25 billion if the Meta deal proceeds. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}


If finalized, this would become Meta’s largest-ever external investment in AI infrastructure—surpassing its traditional pattern of leveraging internal resources. Unlike Microsoft, which invested over $13 billion in OpenAI, Meta’s bet centers directly on data acquisition rather than cloud credit exchange.


The potential deal aligns with CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s strategy to spend up to $65 billion on AI in 2025, supporting open‑source Llama models and the broader generative AI ecosystem. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}


Securing ownership—or a major stake—in Scale AI would give Meta unmatched control over the quality and scale of training data supporting its AI ambitions. This move not only intensifies the AI arms race with Microsoft and Google but also signals a landmark shift in how tech behemoths structure their AI supply chains.


Ultimately, this prospective investment underscores the critical role of clean, labeled data in the future of AI—and highlights Meta’s escalating commitment to compete at the frontier of large‑model innovation.
